title: Turkish Words in English
description: From yogurt to kiosk, discover the surprising Turkish origins of everyday English words!

questions.question: The word 'yogurt' comes from the Turkish 'yogurt.' What does the Turkish verb 'yogurmak' mean?
Which English word for a small open-sided structure or booth comes from the Turkish 'koshk'?
The word 'tulip' comes from Turkish. It derives from 'tulbend,' which refers to what?
Which English word for a type of rug or carpet is closely associated with Turkish weaving traditions?
The word 'horde' entered English from Turkish (via Polish). The Turkish 'ordu' means what?
Which English word for a type of sofa or long seat comes from the Turkish 'divan'?
The word 'ottoman' (a padded footstool) is named after the Ottoman Empire. What does 'Ottoman' derive from?
options: The name of the dynasty's founder, Osman

questions.question: Which English word for a type of tavern or pub has Turkish origins through the word 'kaveh-khaneh'?
The word 'pasha' comes from Turkish. What rank or title did a pasha hold?
options: A high-ranking military or civil official

questions.question: Which English word for a type of peaked military hat comes from the Turkish 'kalpak'?
The word 'caviar' may have Turkish roots through 'havyar.' What is caviar?
Which English word for a type of fast horse relay system used by the Ottomans contributed to postal terminology?
The word 'jackal' entered English through Turkish from the Persian 'shakal.' What animal is a jackal related to?
Which word for a decorated pleasure boat, often associated with Venice, has roots in the Turkish 'gondol'?
The word 'turquoise' (the blue-green gem) is related to Turkey. Why?
options: It matches the color of the Turkish flag
It was first discovered in Turkey
It was traded through Turkey to Europe
